# Getting Started

## Installing and launching R packages

The code chunk below use p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are , then they will be launched into R



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)
```
:::



## Importing the data



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```
:::



# Plotting a simple bar chart



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data= exam_data,
       aes(x=RACE))+
  geom_bar()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS))+
  geom_bar()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



#Plotting a simple dot plot



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS))+
  geom_dotplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Changing bin/binwith size



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(dotsize=0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Y-axis is not very useful, using scale_y_continuous() to hide



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(binwidth=2.5,    #group scores into bins that are 2.5 units wide
               dotsize = 0.5) +      #dotsize=0.5 is half of default size
   scale_y_continuous(NULL,  #Hide the y-axis title
                     breaks = NULL)   #Hide Y-axis scales
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# Plotting a simple histogram



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS))+
  geom_histogram()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### Modifying geometric object by changing geom (add fill="color")



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,            
                 color="black",      
                 fill="light blue")  
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### Modifying geometric object by changing aes(add fill ="sub-group")



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="grey30")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           color= GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="grey30")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### Note：different between using fill and colour

-   fill controls inside fill \[Works on ： bar charts, histograms，boxplots etc.\]

-   colour（color）controls border/outline color \[Works on ： Line plots, scatter plots， edges etc.\]

# Plotting a simple density



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_density()           
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           colour = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# Plotting a simple boxplot



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS,       
           x= GENDER)) +    
  geom_boxplot()            
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Using notch to visually compare the media

-   if not overlap, means the medians are significantly different

-   if overlap, means the difference between medians may not be statistically significant



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch=TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# Plotting a simple violin

A violin plot is a data visualization that combines: **boxplot** (shows median and quartiles) + **density plot** (shows the distribution shape of the data)

The “width” of the graphic is indicated by

-   Wider parts of the violin mean more data in that range

-   Narrower parts mean fewer data there



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# Plotting a simple scatterplot



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point()            
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# **Combine the geom objects**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +                    
  geom_point(position="jitter", #moves dots slightly left and right to avoid overlap
             size = 0.5)        
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2:

-   stat stat\_() function and override the default geom

-   geom\_() function and override the default stat

## Add means value by stat_summary() / geom() method



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",       
               fun = "mean",         
               colour ="red",        
               size=4)               
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary",    #draw it as a dot     
             fun="mean",        #the value shown is the mean  
             colour="red",       # the dot colour   
             size=4)          # the dot size
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# Adding a best fit curve on a scatterplot （geom_smooth() method)



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-22-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(size=0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-22-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### Default smoothing method



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              linewidth=0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2: Facets

Generates small multiples graphics using

-   facet_grid()

-   facet_wrap()

## Working with facet_wrap() :



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20) +
    facet_wrap(~ CLASS)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Working with facet_grid()



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20) +
    facet_grid(~ CLASS)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-25-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2: Coordinates

## For vertical version



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-26-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Using coord_filp() change to horizontal version



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-27-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# Changing the y- and x-axis range

To fixed both x-axia and y-axia range from 0-100



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, size=0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-28-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-28-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2:themes

Built-in themes include:

-   \- theme_gray() (default)

-   \- theme_bw()

-   \- theme_classic()



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_gray()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-29-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_classic()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-30-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-31-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
